intro: Phyllanthus hosokawae, commonly known as the Japanese phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas. Its botanical features include glandular hairs on the stems and leaves, which contribute to its unique appearance. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its compact growth habit and attractive foliage.
